byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Mona Boshnaq from London, Kareem Fahim from Cairo, Thomas Erdbrink from Tehran, Christine Hauser from New York, and Sheikha al-Dosary from Alexandria, Va.

abstract: Unexplained stampede killing at least 717 Muslim pilgrims in Mecca, Saudi Arabia, and injuring more than 850, is latest challenge for new Saudi ruler King Salman; some witnesses say security officials temporarily closed exits from area jammed with pilgrims, causing crowding and panic among pilgrims.
lead_paragraph: The disaster, in which more than 850 were also injured, occurred on the first day of Eid al-Adha, one of the holiest days in the Muslim calendar.

headline.main: Hajj Stampede Near Mecca Leaves Over 700 Dead
headline.print_headline: Unexplained Panic Leaves Hundreds Dead in Mecca Pilgrimage

snippet: The disaster, in which more than 850 were also injured, occurred on the first day of Eid al-Adha, one of the holiest days in the Muslim calendar.
